glsa.title: GIMPS, SETI@home, ChessBrain: Insecure installation
glsa.synopsis: Improper file ownership allows user-owned files to be run with root privileges by init scripts.

background.p: GIMPS is a client for the distributed Great Internet Mersenne Prime Search. SETI@home is the client for the Search for Extraterrestrial Intelligence (SETI) project. ChessBrain is the client for the distributed chess supercomputer.

description.p: GIMPS, SETI@home and ChessBrain ebuilds install user-owned binaries and init scripts which are executed with root privileges.

impact.p: This could lead to a local privilege escalation or root compromise.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
